Description: Red ware pottery ostracon, probably from the wall of a vessel, with remains of three lines of black-painted Greek and five lines of demotic text on exterior, interior uniformly covered with a dark-brown substance.
Curator's comments: Almásy-Martin, A./Martin, C. J. 2021: Always Remember to Check the Back: A Closer Look at Some Published Ostraca in the British Museum and British Library, in: Stolk, J. V./van Loon, G. A. J. C. (eds.), Text Editions of (Abnormal) Hieratic, Demotic, Greek, Latin and Coptic Papyri and Ostraca, P. L. Bat. 37, Leiden/Boston, 33–56.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (51672) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/51672)
Wangstedt 1969 / Demotische Ostraka aus ptolemaeisch-roemischer Zeit (pp.91-2)
